availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Lincoln County } Sct

W. F. McKinney states that he was Captain of Co K 19th Regt Ky Vol. Infty U. S. A. Col W. J. Landram commander that he was captured at the battle at Mansfield La and afterwards held as a prisoner of war by the Confederate forces at Tyler Texas- that while there he heard a Lieutenant in a Texas Regiment say that it was his regiment that killed Capt King and party near Cumberland Ford Ky. That he gives this statement because he believes hopes it may remove an imputation of guilt from John Y. Myers whom he is satisfied is innocent of any complicity in the affair

W. F. McKinney
Capt McKinneys
statement
